content:
Understanding the data transfer process during a handover is crucial because this ensures that the transition is smooth and secure, and maintains the integrity and continuity of operations. Here is a [1.1 Data Transfer Process] from an existing client.

## Flow

- Bella+Canvas to drop data on Azure blob by 2:30am PST, daily. (POS data will be schedule in a separate job at 9am PST). When Bella+Canvas is able to speed up their data warehousing process, http://invent.ai  will be able to account for the new time.
- The system is designed for daily batch allocation. The ETL process requires approximately 5 hours, meaning data will be available for review and action by 11 am CST, as long as data transfers from Bella+Canvas are completed by 6 am CST. The system will adapt automatically if Bella+Canvas team can drop the data faster when they make enhancements to their data warehousing process.
- Data format from Bella Canvas will be CSV format (UTF-8 encoding), Pipe Delimited

## Special Cases

noteClient Specific Terminologies:

- e.g. You can enter instances like Style Color = Option, Site = Store, etc.

Special Days:

- e.g. Christmas period should be ignored from ignore table to avoid forecast fluctuation.

Special Rules:

- e.g. Pairs are eliminated from run scopes if not in the initial allocation scope. (Except stock consolidation runs)

## Pager Duty

> Info: For PagerDuty setup, please contact the CX-IT Rocks team.

PagerDuty is an incident management and notification tool that integrates well with Airflow to alert teams in case of task or job failures. Teams can use PagerDuty to receive alerts when a task or Dag fails, helping ensure a timely response to critical issues.

## SLA and Timeout

SLA and Timeout are mechanisms to manage task and workflow performance, ensuring that tasks or DAGs complete within expected timeframes. They help identify tasks that are running longer than expected, allowing for invention, alerting, or fail-safe measures.

given by UI screen reports, the way of answering should be part of the UI documentation on Cheetah.

metadata.title: Data Discovery & Onboarding

content:
> Info: This page shows the general flow of Forecast Review & Edit.

## Basics

| What? this screen holds | This screen shows upcoming sales forecasts and helps users understand the expected results and accuracy. |
| --- | --- |
| How? this screen works | Forecasts are generated using sales trends, inventory levels, and planned activities. The system automatically processes these inputs to estimate future performance. |
| Why? should I use this | It helps explain the logic behind replenishment decisions and provides a clearer view of future sales expectations. |

## Forecast Review & Edit Features

*Forecast Review & Edit Tabs*Forecast Review:Displays sales forecasts, inventory levels, and last year’s data on product attribute levels. Users can analyze trends, check accuracy, and compare forecast metrics using charts and filters.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
ls. Users can analyze trends, check accuracy, and compare forecast metrics using charts and filters.

Forecast Edit:Allows users to modify forecasts on product and/or store attribute levels. Includes actions for locking, saving, approving, and bulk editing forecasts. Allows higher-level aggregation forecast editing.

Forecast ReviewOn this page, users will be able to observe and analyze the weekly forecasts, sales quantity & store inventory patterns through the selected date range with many flexible display options. The Forecast Review tab provides a high-level, product group-based weekly forecast metrics and provides overall accuracy controls.

> Info: This page does not include store-based dimensions as it is only limited to product groups for better a performance.

Users can filter the data, select metrics, define hierarchies, choose units, and adjust data visibility using the available options.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
t metrics, define hierarchies, choose units, and adjust data visibility using the available options.

Two different graphs, Aggregate Chart and Breakdown Chart, can be accessed for deeper analysis on aggregations and metrics.

The graph display can be modified by selecting a line, bar, or secondary axis for each attribute.

Each selected metric is individually displayed when the aggregations are drilled down.

Forecasts can be edited after selecting the hierarchy and proceeding to the edit screen with the Edit Forecast button.

Aggregate Chart and Breakdown ChartThe Aggregate and Breakdown charts help the user to analyze product performance over time using aggregated metrics such as forecast, sales, and inventory. Drill down into specific product groups for a deeper understanding of variations across different sub-categories and metrics.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
product groups for a deeper understanding of variations across different sub-categories and metrics.

- In the Aggregate Chart, the selected aggregation of the grid is displayed in terms of the selected metrics. This helps the user understand the correlation among the metrics, the inventory, forecast, and sales patterns for promotional periods and holiday seasons. Aggregate chart gives insight into the selected product group to understand the overall performance of the metrics.
- In the Breakdown Chart, the user can compare a selected product group for its sub-groups as it is selected and sorted in the aggregation pane. This holds a single metric value, which is selected from the upper-left dropdown with the chart tab. The chart gives direction on the sub-groups that need deeper control to improve the accuracy. Each sub-group displayed in the category can be compared to understand the root cause and/or find a pattern in the selected metric.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
category can be compared to understand the root cause and/or find a pattern in the selected metric.

Forecast Filtering & AdjustmentThis section explains how to customize the chart view, adjust what’s displayed, and explore metric behavior across different hierarchies.

content: - Users can filter the displayed data from the options.Specify and sort the product groups from the “Aggregations” option. The “Quantity” dropdown controls how data is represented on the chart. Selecting a currency (i.e., USD, EUR, etc.) displays monetary values of the selected metrics in the grid.The metrics can be distinguished for the promotional periods with the help of the  “Show Total” dropdown. The metrics are grouped for the promotional and non-promotional tags.Compare the sales from last year by selecting the “Show Last Year’s Data (LY)” option, allowing the users to analyze year-over-year (YoY) trends and better interpret forecast accuracy. Users can adjust the appearance of the graph by selecting line, bar, or secondary axis for each attribute from the “Settings” option in the upper right corner.The promotional or special day periods are marked on the chart for better insight into the metrics

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
r.The promotional or special day periods are marked on the chart for better insight into the metrics. If at least a single record within the selected aggregation has a promotion and/or special day, the chart is colored for the respective date range.
- The data is displayed as a table below the graph. The grid allows user to drill down and analyze aggregations from their sub-hierarchies if more than one hierarchy is selected (maximum of 3 hierarchies).

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
ations from their sub-hierarchies if more than one hierarchy is selected (maximum of 3 hierarchies).
- Default metrics include Forecast, Sales, and Revenue. Additional metrics such as Store Inventory, Product Count, and Pair Count can be added from the “Metrics” option:Metrics can be hidden, shown, or added based on requirements. The first selected metric is displayed in the collapsed form of the grid.The metric selections are cached, helping user to find the latest metric selection when returning to the screen.The Forecast metric symbolizes the system forecast values of the respective groups.Product and Pair Count metrics are useful for interpreting sales and forecasts. These counts are symbolizing the related counts of the displayed product groups within the respective time ranges.The Store Inventory metric symbolizes the sum of the weekly average inventory of the item-locations.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
The Store Inventory metric symbolizes the sum of the weekly average inventory of the item-locations.

Navigating to Forecast EditAfter analyzing the data in the Forecast Review, the user can switch to Forecast Edit to update the forecast values.

- To go to Forecast Edit, first, a product group should be selected on Forecast Review grid.
- The selected aggregation group records are filtered and displayed on Forecast Edit tab. The selected aggregation information is presented in between the chart and the grid to remind the user of the selection.

> Info: Keep in mind!When navigating from Forecast Review to Forecast Edit, the filters applied in the filter pane are not carried over. Only the selected aggregation is selected and displayed for the Forecast Edit scope.

---

Forecast EditOn this page, users can view detailed data, providing a comprehensive breakdown of forecast components. The screen provides item and location attributes for more flexibility and deeper analysis.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
mponents. The screen provides item and location attributes for more flexibility and deeper analysis.

The user can filter the records by item and/or location attributes and aggregations.

The default forecast metrics are broken down into Base, Promotion, and Special Day forecast values in Forecast Edit metrics. The Base forecast metrics symbolize the system predictions, while the Revised forecast metrics symbolize the edited forecast for the respective breakdowns. The data can be viewed in terms of day, week, and month aggregations. The dates symbolize the week start date and the month start date when the week and month date aggregations are selected, respectively.

The selected metrics are displayed in the chart for the selected aggregation on the grid. The promotional or special day periods are marked on the chart for better insight on the metrics.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
d. The promotional or special day periods are marked on the chart for better insight on the metrics.

Forecast Edit GridZoom In on One Row!To view the metrics for an ag, simply click the magnifying glass icon located on the right side of the corresponding row. Users can save, approve, undo, redo, lock, and unlock the edits while editing forecasts. The action details are provided in upcoming sections.

In the Metrics column, the selected metrics are displayed. The default metrics are as follows,

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
ons.

In the Metrics column, the selected metrics are displayed. The default metrics are as follows,

- Base Forecast: The forecast generated by the selected model.
- Base Promotion Forecast: The breakdown forecast portion of the promotional event.
- Base Special Day Forecast: The breakdown forecast portion of the special days.
- Revised Forecast: The editable forecast field for the Base Forecast. If the cell is not edited, the Base Forecast value is displayed.
- Revised Promotion Forecast: The editable forecast field for the Promotion Forecast. If the cell is not edited, the Base Promotion Forecast value is displayed.
- Revised Special Day Forecast: The editable forecast field for the Special Day Forecast. If the cell is not edited, the Base Special Day Forecast value is displayed.
- Consensus Forecast: The final forecast value after the edits.Consensus Forecast = Revised Forecast + Revised Promotion Forecast + Revised Special Day Forecast.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
s.Consensus Forecast = Revised Forecast + Revised Promotion Forecast + Revised Special Day Forecast.

The editable forecast cells are displayed with a pencil icon. *Only the current and future date forecasts can be edited.*

How to Edit a ForecastOnce inside the Forecast Edit view, this section walks users through the steps to update values and manage locked or revised cells using built-in editing tools.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
through the steps to update values and manage locked or revised cells using built-in editing tools.

- Ensure that the "Revised Forecast" metric is selected in the Metrics section before making edits. Select Base Forecast (system forecast) and Revised Forecast (editable forecast field) for better tracking of the changed values. The same statement applies to the Special Day and Promotion Forecast Metrics.
- Make changes directly by entering values into the Revised Forecast cell or assigning values from the upper right corner action field. Remember, only the current and future date forecasts can be edited.
- The edited values are queued in the system, and the user is notified when the edit operation is successful.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content: > Tip: Good to know!Notification panel For tracking the successful implementation of any forecast edit & approve related action, the notification panel should be used. This panel displays both the actions taken (i.e., save, approve, reset) and the status of the corresponding cells. The panel only displays the current user’s action notifications. The panel does not display other users' actions. Refresh Button To ensure the most up-to-date view of the cell statuses, a page or grid refresh may be required after reviewing the panel.    Forecast Edit UIIf the Revised Forecast value is not equal to the Base Forecast, it indicates that the cell has been edited. Hence, the edited cells are displayed with respective flags. The orange corner flag on a cell indicates the cell is edited and saved.The green corner flag on a cell indicates the cell is edited and approved

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content: e cell is edited and saved.The green corner flag on a cell indicates the cell is edited and approved. The approved records override the system predictions.The Reset button can be used by users who want to discard their previous edits and return the forecast to its original system-generated value (Base Forecast). Reset action directly restores the selected cell’s Revised Forecast to the Base Forecast value.This can be done without unlocking the cell first. Even locked and approved cells can be reset directly.The reset action can be applied to individual cells or to multiple selections.Reset Button Once the Reset operation is performed, the orange or green corner flags are cleared. If the reset cell is edited again, the new value must be saved or approved to ensure the changes are applied and retained in the system.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
he new value must be saved or approved to ensure the changes are applied and retained in the system.

- Undo and Redo shortcuts are available for easier editing.
- After editing, the modified cells are automatically locked, preventing further changes until manually unlocked.  The Unlock option allows previously locked cells to be edited again by restoring them to their editable (pencil icon) state. After unlocking an already edited and saved/approved cell, the corner cell flags remain as the previous state. After re-editing a cell by unlocking it, the records should be saved or approved again to keep the latest edited value.
- If the intention is to discard all edits and revert to the original system-generated forecast, the Reset option can be used without unlocking. This restores the cell to the Base Forecast value, clears existing corner flags.
- Changes should be saved to continue later or approved if finalized.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
clears existing corner flags.
- Changes should be saved to continue later or approved if finalized.

> Note: Please note!If an edited cell is not saved or approved, upon refreshing the page or the grid, the edited value returns to its previous value. In order to keep the latest edited value, the save or approve operations must be completed.

Higher Hierarchy EditingUsers can edit forecast values not only for the most granular level (product-store-day level), but also for the various aggregation levels of product and store attributes and week-month options on time range. This allows users to manage forecasts from both detailed and aggregated scopes.

content:
- As an aggregated level forecast is edited, the value is automatically distributed across the group and broken down the the least granular level. In contrast, editing at a low level applies the change only to that specific record.
- In order to make the edited forecast effective in the system, an action on the edited values must be taken: the edited cells should be saved or approved, for the higher-level edits to be distributed to the granular level.
- As the operation completes, the notification panel notifies the user of the successful edit.
- The affected granular levels are also displayed regarding the “Saved” or “Approved” flags in the forecast cells.
- The edited forecasts on every granular level belonging to the higher level edited group appear with a “lock” icon to imply these cells are already edited.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
to the higher level edited group appear with a “lock” icon to imply these cells are already edited.
- The Reset option can be used without unlocking and clears existing corner flags. Once applied, the cell reverts to the Base Forecast value and must be saved or approved again for the change to take effect.
- The last edited and approved forecast values are taken into account by the system.Assume a user edits a product-store (pair) level forecast, and then same/different user edits forecasts of a higher level that the edited pair belongs to. The latest edit on the higher level overrides the pair level forecast since the latest edited value of the forecast edit records is taken into account.

notePlease note!

After edits are made, the affected cells are automatically locked. To make further changes, these cells must be manually unlocked, ensuring control and traceability even across different hierarchy levels.

Please note!

After edits are made, the affected cells are automatically locked. To make further changes, these cells must be manually unlocked, ensuring control and traceability even across different hierarchy levels.

Internal TabsTo manage forecasts across different aggregation levels more efficiently, users can open internal tabs. Each tab displays its own content upon filtering selections, allowing users to work on multiple groupings in parallel.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
its own content upon filtering selections, allowing users to work on multiple groupings in parallel.

- As the forecasts are edited in different internal tabs, the intersecting forecast records in the tabs are affected by each edit. In order to fully display and align the edited values in different tabs, the refresh icon in the upper right corner of the grid can be utilized. Upon the successful completion of edits, the refresh action displays the latest revised forecast values.
- Any higher-level edit in a tab affects the other tabs' edit flags. Higher-level to granular level edited records are displayed in the same manner as described in the Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide section.

## The Types of Errors or Warnings

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
as described in the Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide section.

## The Types of Errors or Warnings

This section provides an overview of the system-generated warnings users may encounter while interacting with charts or editing data. These warnings are categorized as either informative or actionable, depending on whether they simply inform the user or require an action to proceed.

> Note: Actionable Warnings: Displayed when an input or action violates system rules. These warnings require users to make corrections before continuing.

Negative Value Entered:

Negative forecast quantity is not allowed. The edit is not saved; the cell will be reset to its previous valid value upon grid refresh.

Invalid Text Input:

If a non-numeric value is entered, processing is blocked until the page is refreshed, after which the issue will be resolved.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Forecast Review & Edit - User Guide

content:
entered, processing is blocked until the page is refreshed, after which the issue will be resolved.

> Note: Informative Warnings: Used to inform users about the system state or potential limitations. These warnings do not block the workflow but help maintain awareness.

Reset to System Default:

Resetting to the system default will remove any custom settings, and this action cannot be undone.

> Info: This page shows the general flow of Parameters Configuration.

## Basics

| What? this screen holds | This screen lets users easily adjust key planning parameters to better maintain their strategic input data and support decision-making. |
| --- | --- |
| How? this screen works | Define adjustments using pre-set configuration options. Once the user applies a change, the system automatically updates the predictions and/or orders based on the new inputs for the next run. |
| Why? should I use this | To make it easier to track and adjust configuration settings without needing manual requests.It helps reduce effort for both clients and analysts by allowing direct updates to planning inputs in a faster, more streamlined way. |

## Parameters Configuration Features

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
pdates to planning inputs in a faster, more streamlined way. |

## Parameters Configuration Features

Parameter Configurations:  This section allows users to manage all parameter settings. Users can view, filter, modify, export, or delete configurations. If needed, they can also activate or deactivate them based on business needs.

Configuration Detail: To review the details of a specific configuration, the user can select its Configuration ID to access comprehensive information, including parameter values, validity period, locations, and other attributes. If needed, they can make adjustments and save updates to ensure accuracy.

Create New Configuration: To create a new configuration, users can define key details such as scope, type, and validity period. Once set, they can fine-tune parameter values, apply bulk adjustments, and finalize updates to ensure seamless integration into the system.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
values, apply bulk adjustments, and finalize updates to ensure seamless integration into the system.

Parameter Configurations This section gives users full visibility and control over their existing configurations. Users can filter, update, and manage all existing parameter configurations based on their planning needs, allowing faster decisions and better alignment across teams.

The screen lets the user view all created configurations historically. Each row in the screen corresponds to a created configuration. The configurations can be distinguished by many dimensions:

content:
- Every configuration is distinguished by a unique Configuration ID, and each configuration is created regarding a Solution Type and a scope. The level of granularity of the configuration can be viewed from the Scope column. The details on the creator user of the configurations, last update, and creation times can also be viewed.
- The configurations are valid as long as the durations between the Start Date - End Date. Once the End Date passes, the configuration becomes Passive. Until after the End Date or unless a user deactivates the Configuration ID, the configuration remains Active. The activity duration can be checked from the Remaining Days column in the view.
- The Remaining Days shows the remaining days until the expiration of the configuration. The expired configuration is shown as Finished in Remaining Days. The configurations that are defined without an End Date in order to have the configuration effective without any date limitation, the record is displayed as Unlimited.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
have the configuration effective without any date limitation, the record is displayed as Unlimited.

- To make further adjustments to the data, users can use the Actions menu for additional options.Users can export any configuration whenever needed. If a configuration is no longer required, users can delete it. Also, they can delete from the Actions column.
- The eye-shaped icon allows users to show or hide columns, customizing the displayed data based on their needs.
- The Clear all filters clears all applied filters when needed.

> Note: Keep in mind! Expired records are automatically marked as Passive and cannot be reactivated.

Configuration DetailTo review or fine-tune a specific configuration, the configuration detail view lets the user access the details via its Configuration ID. Users can quickly check the validity period, parameter scope, or make small edits to keep the configuration accurate and relevant.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
lidity period, parameter scope, or make small edits to keep the configuration accurate and relevant.

Users can access a Configuration ID’s details by simply selecting the Configuration Detail tab and the relevant Configuration ID from the dropdown or by directly selecting the Configuration ID from the Parameter Configurations page.

content:
- The detailed view provides the user the details such as Store Code, Parameter Value, Start & End Date, Store Description, Country, Region, City, Location, and other hierarchical attributes. These helper fields assist the user to filter and calibrate the scope and parameter values. These helper fields can be added or configured according to business needs.
- In the Configuration Detail tab, there are some actions that can be done: (1) Add a new scope to the existing parameter, (2) Delete the scope from the existing parameter, (3) Update the value within an existing parameter, (4) Update the date range of some records within the existing parameter,(5) Update the description of the Configuration ID.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
ge of some records within the existing parameter,(5) Update the description of the Configuration ID.
- The above operations can be achieved manually with the steps defined below or by importing a CSV file.Manual Definition:In order to add new items to existing configurations, the "+ Add New" button is used. The required fields to add a new scope to an existing configuration are the scope selection options, date range, and the parameter value. In order to delete a scope from an existing configuration, the related scope row should be selected, and the delete action should be selected from the Actions selection on the upper-right corner of the grid.CSV Import:Uploading a CSV file will modify all parameters in a Configuration ID. Deleted items will be removed, new items will be added, and any changes to existing records will be updated. Unchanged values will remain the same.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
e added, and any changes to existing records will be updated. Unchanged values will remain the same.

- After completing the additions & updates, the changes have to be saved. Save the new changes to ensure the updated data is recorded.

Create New ConfigurationAfter reviewing existing parameter configurations, users can move on to create a new one. This section helps users define a new configuration from scratch, whether they are setting it up manually or uploading it in bulk, depending on their use case and the scale of their data.

- If users want to create a new configuration, they can do so by simply clicking on the “Create New Configuration ” tab.
- To set up a configuration, the required fields like Solution Type, Configuration Type, Start & End Date, Description, and Option, along with other relevant information based on their selection, have to be filled. Upon entering the values into the required fields in the creation step, the parameter value definition step is enabled.

content: How to define the scope of a Configuration?The first step in parameter configurations is selecting the scope source of the definition.At this stage, there are two options to proceed: Use 'Create Manually' to define configurations within the system, or 'Create with CSV' to bulk upload configurations with predefined data. Create Manually: Define the configuration by selecting the scope and defining the date range & parameter value.Create ManuallyThe Scope is formed by,Typing the required Codes (ProductCode, StoreCode, WarehouseCode, SupplierCode). The Codes are the codes that are provided in the master data. The codes can be defined with comma separators and can easily be pasted from CSV files.Selecting existing Groups created via the Product-Store Grouping screen with the help of the available groups listing dropdown. Product-Store Grouping screen  Create with CSV: Upload a .csv file containing the required details

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content: . Product-Store Grouping screen  Create with CSV: Upload a .csv file containing the required details. The specific columns needed will depend on the selected scope (e.g., Product Code, Store Code). The sample CSV provides a template for required fields based on the selected scope. Create with CSVThe Scope is formed by,Entering the Group Codes that the system generates upon the Group creation in the Product-Store Grouping screen. The Group Name value in the created groups list of the Product-Store Grouping screen should be used in this column.Entering the Codes (ProductCode, StoreCode, WarehouseCode, SupplierCode) directly into the relevant scope option fields. The Codes are the codes that are provided in the master data. Note on Date Format: When using date fields in the CSV, ensure that the values follow the yyyy-mm-dd format, as this is the standard sequence used in the system (year, month, day)

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
follow the yyyy-mm-dd format, as this is the standard sequence used in the system (year, month, day). Users can use any separator, such as "/" or "-", but the order must always be year-month-day.- Once the required fields are completed, the "Next/Adjust Values" button is enabled, which will allow the user to continue with the parameter creation flow.
- To update the “Parameter Value” section, users can do so row by row or apply changes to all selected records using the Actions menu.
- If users want to add more scope combinations for the parameter, they can use the "Add New" option.
- If some of the scope combinations have to be deleted - since the scope option selection creates the cartesian product of the options -, the unnecessary scope combinations can be deleted with the Delete action in the Actions button.
- Once edits are complete, users can use the “Save the New Changes” option to finalize the updates.
- The saved parameter configurations are now ready for the next run.

content: Additional Time: Users can use this to define extra buffer time for the cover period in their planning process.Blocked Scope: If there are specific products, sources, or destinations to be excluded from the run scopes, they can be defined in this section.Fix Target: Users can set a fixed inventory target that overrides automatically calculated values.Holdout Quantity: The additional quantity that will be added to the target level in order to maintain a promotion push, or a specific event/deal push in phases.Ignored Days: Users can exclude specific days (e.g., holidays, promotions) from prediction inputs. The definition can be made on item or location aggregations. This parameter has 2 date input fields: Start Date & End Date. These fields denote the date range to be ignored.Inventory Eligibility: Defines whether a product is available at a specific store. Configurations can be made on item and location groupings

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content: product is available at a specific store. Configurations can be made on item and location groupings. Both fields are required for the master’s eligibility in the inventory management solutions. This parameter denotes that the defined item locations will be eligible for replenishment in the specified date range.Lead Time: Override to lead time value. Lead time is the duration between placing an order in the DC and receiving the goods at the store. It may include processing time in the warehouse, shipping time between the source and destination, and processing time in the destination.Look Ahead (Early Push): Holds 2 value fields, Look Ahead and Forecast Interval. Look Ahead denotes the choice of early push regarding the records, True or False

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content: Forecast Interval. Look Ahead denotes the choice of early push regarding the records, True or False. Forecast Interval denotes the look-ahead period to find the highest demand in the upcoming cover periods, in order to push the high-demand inventory in phases, earlier.Max DOS: Set a maximum number of days of supply for guardrailing the target inventory

content: . Max Safety Stock DOS: Users can define the upper limit for safety stock based on days of supply.Max Safety Stock Ratio: Use this to limit safety stock as a percentage of expected cover period demand.Max Target: Define the upper inventory limit to secure the shelf space usage and/or capacities for business guardrailing.Min DOS: Users can set a minimum number of days of supply to avoid stockouts.Min Safety Stock DOS: Define the lowest acceptable safety stock in days of supply.Min Safety Stock Ratio: Use this to define minimum safety stock as a ratio of expected cover period demand.Min Target: Set the minimum inventory level that must be maintained.Order Alert Threshold: Depending on the defined order thresholds for item locations, when the order exceeds or falls behind the threshold, an alert is triggered.OUTL Day Addition: User can add extra target inventory to their order for more accurate level calculations.Presentation Stock: Define the minimum display quantity to ensure a level of

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
rate level calculations.Presentation Stock: Define the minimum display quantity to ensure a level of inventory at a location for an item, which can be due to solely display purposes or OoS mitigation strategies.Target Alert Threshold: Depending on the defined target thresholds for item locations, when the target exceeds or falls behind the threshold, an alert is triggered.

| Solution Type | The type of solution where this parameter is applied, such as Store Replenishment, Transfer, or DC Replenishment |
| --- | --- |
| Configuration Type | The type of configuration applied, like Blocked Scope, Additional Time, Max Target, etc. |
| Scope | The grouping level the configuration applies to, such as Product Code, Store Group, or DFU Group. The available groupings in these  options are based on product store groups defined in the Product Store Groups screen |
| Start Date | The date on which the configuration becomes active |
| End Date | The last day the configuration remains activeNote: The End Date is inclusive, meaning the configuration remains valid through the end date specified |
| Remaining Days | The number of days left until expiration. Displays Unlimited if no expiry is set |
| Description | A short explanation given by the user on the configuration’s purpose |
| User Name | The user who created the configuration |

## The Types of Errors or Warnings

This section provides an overview of the system-generated warnings users may encounter while interacting with charts or editing data. These warnings are categorized as either informative or actionable, depending on whether they simply inform the user or require an action to proceed.

> Note: Actionable Warnings: Displayed when an input or action violates system rules. These warnings require users to make corrections before continuing.

Negative Value Entered for a Non-Negative Parameter:

Negative values can not be defined for non-negative parameters.

String Value Entered for a Numeric Parameter:

String values can not be defined for numeric parameters.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
ing Value Entered for a Numeric Parameter:

String values can not be defined for numeric parameters.

> Note: Informative Warnings: Used to inform users about the system state or potential limitations. These warnings do not block the workflow but help maintain awareness.

Delete Selected Configurations:

Once the selected configurations are deleted, the action cannot be undone.

Configuration Status Change Restriction:

When a configuration is expired, the ID becomes passive as shown in the caption. These configurations can be reactivated by extending the End Date first.

CSV Import Rules for an Existing Configuration ID:

Uploading a CSV file will modify all parameters in a Configuration ID. Deleted items will be removed, new items will be added, and any changes to existing records will be updated. Unchanged values will remain the same.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
e added, and any changes to existing records will be updated. Unchanged values will remain the same.

Invalid Data Type:
During CSV import, any field that requires an integer value must contain a valid integer. If a non-integer value is detected in these fields, the system will block the import and display an error specifying the affected row.

Unrecognized Entities in Uploaded File:
Data that does not exist in the system database cannot be processed.

## FAQ

- What happens if the user defines multiple configurations for an item-location? Which configuration’s value will be valid?

Each active configuration is taken into account for the UI parameter data input resolution process. There are a couple layers of rules for resolving the date range, duplications, overlapping dates, precedence among option levels.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
rules for resolving the date range, duplications, overlapping dates, precedence among option levels.

The rule set outlines on the logic used to resolve parameter values for each product–store combination, by filtering relevant records, handling overlaps, and applying priority and overrides across different data sources and scope levels.

The scope combinations are resolved with respect to a priority sequence. For instance, defining a parameter on Product Code is more granular and specific that the ones defined from the Product Group option. Hence, Product Code and Store Code option overrides the ones defined on Product Code level. The most granular data overrides the least.

The below table provides a symbolic priority sequence to illustrate the rule described above. For all scope combinations and priorities of each solution, expand the lists below.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

described above. For all scope combinations and priorities of each solution, expand the lists below.

| Product-Store (Pair) Group | 2 |
| Product + Store Group | 3 |
| Product Group + Store | 4 |
| Product Group + Store Group | 5 |
| Product | 6 |
| Product Group | 7 |
| Store | 8 |
| Store Group | 9 |
| Warehouse | 10 |
| Warehouse Group | 11 |

content:
- For each distinct scope combination (item-based, location-based, or item-location-based), the system filters down to the most recently updated record if there are multiple candidates.
- There can be multiple records that match one of the following combinations:item + priority + start date + end datelocation + priority + start date + end dateitem + location + priority + start date + end date
- When duplicate records exist for any of these combinations, the system selects the one that was most recently updated (based on a Updated At timestamp).
- Records are filtered to include only those where the target date falls between start date and end date.
- Records are then aggregated or reduced down to the least granular level, specifically product–store level. That means if parameters are defined at broader levels (e.g., region or category), they’re eventually boiled down to specific product and store combinations.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
.g., region or category), they’re eventually boiled down to specific product and store combinations.
- If multiple parameter records overlap due to overlapping date ranges, these are aggregated using a defined method (e.g., min, max, average, sum) to resolve conflicts.
- Parameters defined at different scope levels (e.g., Product, Store Group, Product Group + Warehouse) are resolved by sorting based on priority. The values with the lowest priority number (i.e., highest precedence) are selected.
- At the end of this process, each product–store pair has a resolved parameter value, and the system ensures that the most specific (i.e., most granular) configuration takes precedence, assuming it has the highest priority.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
specific (i.e., most granular) configuration takes precedence, assuming it has the highest priority.
- If the parameter has another data source fed from the ETL process, the merge operation is made depending on the pre-configured rule: (1) override ETL values with UI definitions(2) use ETL values(3) merge both by a pre-defined aggregation method (e.g. min, max, average, sum)The override rules applies when a product - store has records on both sources (ETL and UI). If a product - store only has a parameter value on UI, the UI value is taken.
- This logic is about narrowing down parameter values to the most relevant and specific configuration for each product-store pair by filtering by date, resolving overlaps through aggregation, and applying priority-based rules to pick the final value.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas Parameters Configuration - User Guide

content:
, resolving overlaps through aggregation, and applying priority-based rules to pick the final value.

- How does the aggregation/grouping resolve work? i.e. which value would an item-location get if it has a configuration defined on the Product Group + Warehouse option and the Product + Store Group option, both valid at the same time?

The broad process flow of parameter value resolution is provided in the previous question.

For the answer of this question, regarding the priority list given in the answer of the previous question, Product + Store Group option is  more granular than Product Group + Warehouse scope option. The Product + Store Group level defined parameter value is taken as the UI parameter value input.

- How can I understand which Configuration ID’s value is used in the system orders?

This feature is not yet available.

content: #QuestionsCategoryData Mapping1How many countries do you have operations in?Descriptive Information2In which countries do you have operations?Descriptive Information3Could you please share rough figures about channel structure – “revenue share by channel” (Own stores, franchise, e-commerce, other on-line, corner, shop-in-shops etc.)Descriptive Information4What is the value of inventory in stores and warehouses?Descriptive Information5How many stores do you have?Descriptive Information6How many stores do you have in your top-3 markets?Descriptive Information7How many warehouses do you have? Where are they located? (Main DCs, Satellite DCs etc.)Descriptive Information8Could you please share rough “number of options and/or SKUs” per season or per year (SS, AW, Continuous)Descriptive Information9What is the number of SKUs that make up 80% of monthly sales?Descriptive Information10Could you please share average depth per SKU (Rough numbers / estimation would be enough)Descriptive Informati

metadata.title: Bella Canvas -  Pre-Onboarding: Client As-Is / Design Questions

content:
please share average depth per SKU (Rough numbers / estimation would be enough)Descriptive Information11What is weeks of supply or week cover on a total basis? Could you please provide for stores and DCs seperatly?Descriptive Information12What is the overall availability?Descriptive Information13Do you measure lost sales? What is the overall lost sales? Descriptive Information14What is the overall availability when DC has stock for the SKUs?Descriptive Information15What is the overall lost sales when DC has stock for the SKUs?Descriptive InformationQuestions below would be more specific to Pre-Sales/Pre SOW discovery for Wholesale partners

Brand = Invent Partner (True Classic)

Retailer = Wholesale partner (Macys)

Sell-In = Brand selling to Retailer

Sell-Out = Retailer Selling to Consumer (Gigi confirmed True Classic receives POS., but sure how much)

metadata.title: Bella Canvas -  Pre-Onboarding: Client As-Is / Design Questions

content:
ll-Out = Retailer Selling to Consumer (Gigi confirmed True Classic receives POS., but sure how much)

Ideally - for any client we would want to phase a wholesale implementation to focus first on the Retailers that provide data (frequency and granularity) that meet our requirements. This will be the hard part, we should get ahead of this with Nebula team.

If Sell-In/POS data is not complete for our forecasting, we could use sell-out as the basis for the forecasted shipments for each Retailer. Its not ideal, but this would at least give the brand and idea of THEIR total demand by category/class/style to suggest orders to Retailers.

Forecasting - need to approach with multiple forecasts and inputs

- Demand of Brand Product at Retailer to Consumer - needs Sell-Out Data & Retailer Plans, History
- Demand of Brand shipping to retailer - need Sell In history and shipping targets
- Demand of Brand Products Owned and Operated

Inventory and Planning

metadata.title: Bella Canvas -  Pre-Onboarding: Client As-Is / Design Questions

content:
n history and shipping targets
- Demand of Brand Products Owned and Operated

Inventory and Planning

- How many distribution channels (dept store, online, mid-tier, etc) and wholesale partners are there?
- Which wholesale partners share sell-out (partner → end consumer) data and at what frequency / granularity? We also would need to dig into attribution if available…
- Who is responsible for projecting sell-in and sell-out ?
- How is sell in (Brand → Retailer) managed and projected ? At what level ?
- Does Brand have visibility to Retailers merch financial plans (sales and receipt) plans for the Brand ? If so, at what level and frequency
- Which Retailers make up 80% of your wholesale shipments ?
- How is Brand considering current Retailer inventory while projecting future sell-in ?
- Are there agreements to hold levels of safety stock or ATS for retail partners ?
- What is the ordering/buy expectation ? Are we forecasting DC→Retailer or DC→ Vendor ?

Assortment and Pricing

metadata.title: Bella Canvas -  Pre-Onboarding: Client As-Is / Design Questions

content:
he ordering/buy expectation ? Are we forecasting DC→Retailer or DC→ Vendor ?

Assortment and Pricing

- How are assortments differentiated between channels and retail partners ?
- What rules or constraints impact what product can be sold to each retailer ?
- What percentage of sell-in is confirmed pre-season vs placed as in-season buys ?
- How is costing (wholesale and retail) determined ?
- Who owns the pricing and promotional decision? If retailer, does Brand have full view to the marketing and promo calendar?

content: he location. That is why that demand shouldn’t be accounted to store safety stock, however, it should be linked to related DC network to cover regional demandBopis: Buy Online Pick In Store:Do we see which physical store has fulfill that? Where does the sales accounted forSTHDo we see which physical store has fulfilled that? Where does the sales accounts forFor the above topic, we need to align on this type of matrix:Ignore the Ecom Sales Type Breakdown partOrigin Store Forecast means = Y: those ecom sales types will be used in BM forecasting and BM safety stock calculationsOrigin Store DC Network FC=Y means, those transactions will not impact store forecast or store safety stock, BUT they will impact related DC forecast and DC Safety stockAnother topic for Ecom. Let’s say Ecom fulfilments can be done from:DC orStoresFor retailers, it is better to fulfill from DC for cost purposes. In this case, Invent system should protect some inventory at the DC and not sent to Brick&Mortar stores

metadata.title: Bella Canvas -  Pre-Onboarding: Client As-Is / Design Questions

content:
this case, Invent system should protect some inventory at the DC and not sent to Brick&Mortar stores. Let’s call it DC Ecom Reserve.Questions:Who will calculate the DC Ecom Reserve Units? Both options are valid:If client side: Invent need to get the “reserve units” either from ETL or Parameter screenIf Invent side: Invent will do a forecast for ecom store, any automatically reserve their “target” as top priority to protect in DC (this is already a feature in the product)

Performance, consolidation, clearance, capacity? Are all product groups consolidated into a store/region in certain periods?GeneralProvide current data flow and system flow (excel, ppt, pdf)3Is there a scope define for products & stores for transfer? Are there products that are closed and opened for transfer periodically? (product-specific)ScopeProvide in scope products at scope or provide blocked pr

content:
This page displays the overall user stories list, in order to understand the fulfilled and queued stories for the UI roadmap. The document aims to explain the UI capabilities from the user perspective, to better convey the UI to the clients.

From May 2024 on, the source of truth for the user stories, is this documentation.

[Legacy user story doc ref.](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1WfKQLXZsSOVF8L6dEN9UKH2YeTmF6Uf3L0E5tsUBq8w/edit#slide=id.g2391e1daf6e_0_111)

## Filtering

Covered user stories:

- User is able to filter with respect to product, store attributes, including style-color, dfu filters.

Backlog user stories:

- User can filter the data based on warehouse or supplier information.

## Product Store Groups

Covered user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
the data based on warehouse or supplier information.

## Product Store Groups

Covered user stories:

- The user can create new product and/or store groups, for later use within the screens.
- The user can view the already created groups from their corresponding tabs: Product, Store, Product-Location.
- The user can export the already created groups by clicking on the “green magnifier” icon, then clicking the “export” icon.
- The user can select which columns to export from the “eye” icon.
- The user can edit the name and descriptions of the already created groups by clicking on the “yellow pen” icon.
- The user can edit the filter details of the existing groups.
- The user can delete the created groups.
- The user can define which users can see a group.
- The user can change the owner of the groups, from the “Actions” button.
- The user can create a group by uploading a template excel or by defining and filtering the product/store attributes manually.

Backlog user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
ate excel or by defining and filtering the product/store attributes manually.

Backlog user stories:

- the user is able to group sources: supplier group and warehouse group
- the user can generated the pair grouping with respect to the system mapping, assortment data.

## Control Tower

Covered user stories:

- The below listed control tower elements can be configured to display on-off in the control tower screen.

Backlog user stories:

- Users can observe the data update times for each element on control tower.

### Daily Order Statistics

Covered user stories:

- User can see the daily order summary. Can go to store and dc rpl screens directly from the info panel.

- User can see the inventory load in the stores.

- User can see the PO in landing, upcoming, delayed breakdowns.

Backlog user stories:

- User can further analyzed the PO details by clicking on the arrow on the upper corners of the PO cards.

### Sales, Inventory & Order History

Covered user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
w on the upper corners of the PO cards.

### Sales, Inventory & Order History

Covered user stories:

- user can see the historic sales, forecast, inventory data from dashboard, fed from forecast edit screen.

- The user can analyze and compare the last year on a fixed date period. If required, can go to details on forecast edit screen.

Backlog user stories:

- User can review the historic order amounts

### KPI Overview

Covered user stories:

- User can view current kpi status on important operational kpi’s and can filter through new store/products’ status.
- The user is able to see the lost sales ratio from the previous week
- The user is able to see the current days availability and dos wrt the latest inventory data and forecasts
- User can go to corresponding kpi reports from the show report link, but can not go to these reports directly filtered with the current page’s filter.

Backlog user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
can not go to these reports directly filtered with the current page’s filter.

Backlog user stories:

- User can compare the current period’s KPI with Last 8 weeks OR year to date kpi averages, and understand where they stand

- User can view current KPI status on important operational kpi’s and can analyze for different time dimensions

### Sales Trend Changes

Covered user stories:

- user can analyze the sales changes by comparing current week with the previous 4 weeks average. The top 10 changes will be listed in each aggregation.

- The details can be controlled via a go-to link to the forecast screen.

- The user can go to the screen unfiltered, with a new browser tab. can filter the corresponding data and control accordingly.

- user can click on the trend change graphs and can go to the forecast page directly filtered with the selection

Backlog user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
e graphs and can go to the forecast page directly filtered with the selection

Backlog user stories:

- User can click on the trend change graphs and can go to the forecast page directly filtered with the selection.
- User can understand the trend changes in target and dos data, and act upon these changes.
- User can select the date period to be shown in the graph.

### Special Days & Promo

Covered user stories:

- The user can see upcoming events in the upcoming 2 months calendar. The top 5 events detected will be listed in the pane.

- The details can be controlled from the promo screen, with a go-to link. The user can only control promo from that go to link. If the user wants to see the special day details, they should go to the forecast review screen and control starting from the highest category aggregation

Backlog user stories:

### Alerts Summary

Covered user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
m the highest category aggregation

Backlog user stories:

### Alerts Summary

Covered user stories:

- The user can easily detect the critical alerts defined and detected in the system, for the current day. The user should go to the alert screen from the control tower’s pane, to further understand the alert.
- The top 5 rows of the critical alerts are displayed in the alert summary pane.
- The user can filter the alert summary section with the control tower’s filter elements.

Backlog user stories:

## Forecast Review & Edit

### Forecast Review

Covered user stories:

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
ments.

Backlog user stories:

## Forecast Review & Edit

### Forecast Review

Covered user stories:

- The user is able to review the forecasts in the desired product aggregation
- The user can review the time series pattern in the “aggregate chart”, for the selected metrics, by clicking & filtering the breakdown in the grid.
- The user can review the child aggregations’ pattern within each other, for a selected metric, in the “breakdown chart”.
- The user can filter the past and future periods and directly filter an exact week from the “select weeks” filter.
- The user can compare the promo periods metrics and last years corresponding data.
- The user can click-out a metric in the aggregate chart, and make the metric disappear in the chart, hence comparing in a simple visual.
- The user should click on an aggregation in the grid and then go to the edit screen for further store aggregated analysis and/or editing.
- The user can create filters and apply it on the selection.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
ore aggregated analysis and/or editing.
- The user can create filters and apply it on the selection.

Backlog user stories:

- User can easily navigate the critical forecast results by filtering the alert flags
- User can easily navigate the screen using smart directions, where instead of using filters, they can click on buttons to view specific results. Example:Last week's MAPE was poorPoor promo performanceRapidly increasing salesRapidly decreasing salesForecast for the upcoming special day is very different from last year

content:
- The user can select product and store aggregations to control the underlying data, selected from the review screen.
- The user can compare the underlying data in many in-window “edit tab”s. The user can click and open a new edit tab, opening with the existing filtered selection, can change the aggregation and metrics.
- The user can navigate among the tabs but can not understand if a data in another tab is edited, instantly.
- The user can create filters and apply it on the existing tabs.
- The user can observe a record on the grid, click on the magnifier icon in the column and can filter the graph with respect to the selected aggregated data.
- The unselected records’ icon remain gray, the selected row stands out in the grid.
- The user can edit multiple cells and save it as draft, for later use.
- The user can undo the edited cells.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
r can edit multiple cells and save it as draft, for later use.
- The user can undo the edited cells.
- The user can lock the edited values to imply that it is changed by a user, so another user can see someone else had edited the related value and act upon that.The user can edit the forecasts and as the forecasts are edited the values are automatically locked. The higher level edits also locks the lower level aggregations in order to follow up that the edited higher level forecast will overwrite the lower level values.
- The user can save the edits as draft but the draft edits can only be viewed by the user only.
- The user can edit the forecasts from a higher aggregation, and the value is broken down to the item-destination level, for later use in the upcoming forecast runs.
- The user ser can see the results in other date aggregations: day forecast can be aggregated to week or month; week forecast to month, and so on
- The user can edit the forecasts upon given permission type.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
nth; week forecast to month, and so on
- The user can edit the forecasts upon given permission type.
- The user can reset the edited value in the following days, if they edited a forecast on the prior days. They can reset the forecast edits by selecting the pairs&dates, clicking reset button to reset the pair’s edits to the base forecast flow.

Backlog user stories:

- User can easily navigate the critical forecast results by filtering the alert flags
- User can easily navigate the screen using smart directions, where instead of using filters, they can click on buttons to view specific results. - Forecast validations. Should there be a forecast edit validation? Should we prevent users from entering 10,000 for a product that is supposed to be 10?

content:
- The user can land on this page by clicking on the detail arrow icon in the control tower.
- The user can filter the records on product and store attributes via the filter icon on the left.
- The user can compare the constrained and unconstrained orders.
- The user can filter the orders according to “status” to see the auto approved and not-approved orders. The auto approveds are directly sent to clients system after the replenishment run is completed.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
rs. The auto approveds are directly sent to clients system after the replenishment run is completed.
- The user can review the “order status” on the grid. The icons correspond to Status column on the UI grid.🟢 Order received = the item is on order day, does not have any shortage or alert. these records are auto approved and sent by the invent systemInsufficient supply = supply is short for fulfilling the need🔴 Order Guardrail = the item is on order day, the item-destination is detected in a critical alert, hence the order is not automatically sent to the client system. This order should be reviewed by the users and the alert can be edited (via the hub team) and/or acknowledged by the user.⚫ Not Order Day / Out of frequency = the pair is not on its order day⚫ Alert Detected  = the pair is not on its order day and an alert is related with this pair
- The user can remove the applied filters from the “filter out” icon on top right corner of the grid.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
The user can remove the applied filters from the “filter out” icon on top right corner of the grid.
- The user can add/remove unwanted columns from the “eye” icon on top right corner of the grid.
- The user can further analyze a record’s details by clicking on the “graph icon” in the action column. the records’ time series details can be found there, and the order is controlled with the historic metric details.
- The user can edit the replenishment orders. The edited orders are transferred to clients system upon approval
- The detected alerts in the system (shown in the alerts screen), is statused as “order guardrail”. if the user reviews these records and decide on editing the orders or approving them, the user can edit the adjusted quantity column in the grid. after approving the edits by clicking on “approve”, the user can export the selection from the icon above the grid.
- The user can not edit an order if the total order amount exceeds the supply.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
icon above the grid.
- The user can not edit an order if the total order amount exceeds the supply.
- The user can select multiple rows, edit and approve them.
- The user can see the high level summary from aggregated grid and can click and go to detailed results in the next internal tab.
- The user can review the orders in prepack amounts. The detailed list of user stories are here
- The user can filter the orders with quick filters, both in aggregated summary tabs and the detailed editable tab.
- The user can drilldown the orders in aggregations (from the  button in the aggregation columns in the grid). The drilldown opens a new internal tabs for detailed analysis, with the drilldowned aggregations name on the tabç
- The user can observe the soq's not satisfying the need, from the coloring of the constrained qty cells.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
user can observe the soq's not satisfying the need, from the coloring of the constrained qty cells.
- The user can control the orders with respect to the WOS, DOS, Availability KPIs for future or current amounts (future = calculated with forecast; current=calculated with past avg sales). These KPIs are calculated with respected to the specific row on the fly.
- The user can edit the orders upon given permission type.

Backlog user stories:

- The user can view crossdock orders with its own analysis columns by clicking on the related buttonThe user can view crossdock orders with its own analysis columns by clicking on the related button.
- The user can approve all records by clicking the “approve all” button.
- The user can review future orders by filtering the run date.
- The user can add manual orders, which can be out of scope for the given day.
- The editable order statuses can be configured among customers.

content:
- The user can land on this page by clicking on the detail arrow icon in the control tower/daily order statistics/supplier to DC.
- The user can filter the records on product attributes via the filter icon on the left.
- The user can review the “status” on the grid.Green = purchase order generatedRed = purchase order is not generated due to an alert detected
- The user can select multiple rows and edit the purchase order value and approve them.
- The user can download the purchase order file.
- The user can remove the applied filters from the “filter out” icon on top right corner of the grid.
- The user can add/remove unwanted columns from the “eye” icon on top right corner of the grid.
- The user can see FC & Sales for 6months of period when user clicks on picture icon under Actions grid.
- The user can see the approval status turn to green when user selects a row and approves it
- The user can click on calculated fields and see thee filtered grids correctly.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
row and approves it
- The user can click on calculated fields and see thee filtered grids correctly.
- The user can lock and unlock POs by clicking on unlock and lock icons.
- The user can undo and redo POs by clicking on undo and redo icons.

Backlog user stories:

- The user can further analyze a record’s details by clicking on the “graph icon” in the action column. the records’ time series details can be found there, and the order is controlled with the historic metric details.
- The user can see the PO details from a tab in the screen. Can control the po’s by landing, delayed, upcoming
- The user is able to display target modifiers
- The user is able to define min - max dos and target caps from parameter configuration
- The user can edit the orders upon given permission type.
- The user can see a high level summary and then go to the details on the internal tab.

content:
- The user can view all of the creations, listed and sorted by creation time & update time.
- The user can click on a created adjustment, and go to the details on the next in-window tab.
- The user can edit value and/or start-end dates of the adjustment.
- The user can add new records to the existing adjustment and save.
- The user can delete existing records from the adjustment & save.
- The user can create new adjustment from a pre-defined list of adjustment types The created adjustment type can be listed in the first tab of the screen.
- The user can create a new adjustment by importing the template.
- The user can create a new adjustment by selecting from store and product level aggregations. with existing groups or by the created groups from the product store groups screenThe user can create a new adjustment by selecting from dfu (planning level) or location type level aggregations. (warehouse, supplier)The user can define an adjustment indefinitely.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

content:
cation type level aggregations. (warehouse, supplier)The user can define an adjustment indefinitely.
- The user can create a new adjustment by manually typing in the selected aggregation values.
- The user can edit a couple records in the adjustment type, before finalizing the records.
- The user should create/update the adjustments until a pre-defined fixed time in a day. All of the adjustments will be incorporated in the early replenishment runs and the next days scheduled regular runs.The user should let the hub team know if they do not want to wait for the next scheduled run and/or if they are testing with new parameters, in order to transfer the data from the ui to the system.
- If the user wants to create same parameter for different solutions, the user should define those adjustments separately in the first place.
- The user can view the deactivated, active and ended parameter listings.

metadata.title: Bella Canvas User Stories

rately in the first place.
- The user can view the deactivated, active and ended parameter listings.
- The user can update the status of a parameter listing, can deactive the adjustment, or can active the adjustment if the end date has not passed.The user  can not reactivate a listing if the end date has passed. The user should first update the enddate of the adjustment, then can re-active the adjustment.
- The user can view how many days left for the listing.
